title: Shared folder doesn't show its content
body:
### Actual behaviour
-When I wan to see the content of a Shared folder with the Android App (the owner is another user) shows the message "Nothing here...."
- The parent view shows the total size of the folder and it's not empty.

### Expected behaviour
-I expect to see the content
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open the shared folder
2. See the message "Nothing here..."

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Nexus 5

Stock or customized system: LineageOS

ownCloud app version: 2.3.0

ownCloud server version: 9.1.5 (stable)

title: Automatic upload?
body:
Hi all. I have just stumbled across this while looking for an alternative to Dropbox camera upload.

I have an owncloud server set up and working on Ubuntu 16.04 and I can connect to it find, add, download, delete files etc no problem.

I have tried using the "instant upload" option but I just can't seem to figure out how to get it to work. I set the path to my camera folder and take a photo and absolutely nothing happens in the app whatsoever. Nothing gets queued, nothing uploaded, no errors, nothing. Dropbox syncs the same photo fine.

I am pulling my hair out trying to figure this out and I can't find anything in the manual while would help.

I am using a Galaxy S7 and my camera is set to save to a 64GB microSD card. I tried changing back to phone storage and set that folder in the owncloud app but it makes no difference.

PLEASE can someone help?

title: Additional instant upload sources
body: I'd like to be able to configure instant uploads from the "Screenshots" folder, in addition to Photos and Video. At that point it may make more sense just to allow arbitrarily many instant upload sources, rather than incorporating more and more specific use cases as they arise and polluting the configuration menu.

title: Uploads can get stuck when network access is lost while sending data
body:
### Actual behaviour
If network access is lost by the device while an upload is in progress, this upload could get blocked until the app is killed, preventing also that other uploads in the queue start. If the user tries to cancel this upload, there will be an ANR and the app will crash.

The problem occurs if the network is lost while one of the PUT operations is writing part of the file in the socket.

### Expected behaviour
The uploads fails after some time without connectivity. In Android 5 or later, it is retried automatically when Wifi network is available.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Upload some videos to a server using an HTTP connection (not in HTTPS).
2. Open uploads view.
2. When one of the videos is uploading (progress > 0%, < 100%), enable 'plane mode' in the device.
3. Wait around 20 seconds.
4. Disable 'plane mode'.

NOTE: it doesn't happen every time, the network has to be lost exactly while the app is writing to the socket. To improve the chances it occurs (and be able to fix it), increase the size of the buffer in https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/blob/20c9830922601f686606b0cb795ba56aab4dddee/src/com/owncloud/android/lib/common/network/ChunkFromFileChannelRequestEntity.java#L60 to ```com.owncloud.android.lib/resources.files.ChunkedUploadRemoteFileOperation.CHUNK_SIZE``` .

### Environment data
Android version: 5. Could happen in other versions, not sure.

Device model: Samsung Galaxy Tab S3

ownCloud app version: 2.3.0
 
ownCloud server version: any

NOTE2: the bug is fixed for HTTPS servers, a write timeout was enforced in ```xxxxx``` , and will be released in version 2.4.0. A similar solution for HTTP is not possible, since the socket implementation for HTTP has no method por write timeout.

title: Add "Go to Folder" action on tapping a completed upload
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Tapping on an upload notification does nothing

### Expected behaviour
- Tapping on an upload notification does something :) 

 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Tap on a completed upload notification in the notification tray, or open the Uploads activity in the Android client 
2. Owncloud Android app lists all uploads
3. Tap a (completed) entry

I hoped this would do something, like open the folder, as I'd like to:
* Rename the file
* Share the file
Opening the file isn't necessarily useful by default as I likely already have the file locally, though maybe useful in a long-tail, but the default tap would definitely be if it from opening the target folder, hopefully even showing/selecting the new file. 

I've already navigated the tree once to upload the file, perhaps useful to not have to do that again to manipulate the uploaded file? 


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
Probably (client issue) 


### Environment data
Android version:
7.1.1
Device model: 
Nexus 9, Nexus 7
Stock or customized system:
Both
ownCloud app version:
Latest Play Store (2.3.0)
ownCloud server version:
9.1

title: Get rid of 'contacts' permission group request
body:
Some of the permissions requested in ```AndroidManifest.xml``` to access system ```AccountManager``` are resulting in```contacts``` permission group being listed in the settings of the ownCloud app, requested by disabled. 

![contacts_group__device-2017-04-11-165033](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2225614/24915289/12e7ab12-1ed7-11e7-9d68-c5c65794e4e9.png)

It's highly probable that we don't need all the permissions in the manifest, and that we can get rid of ```contacts```. 

We should ask as few permissions as possible, so nice to have.

title: Multiple Share Links
body:
#Multiple share links is a new feature in oC10, that allows to create more than one public link over the same file/folder.

Current behaviour:

- The Android mobile app only supports one public link. 
- The behaviour right now is showing the first one of the public links created on the server side. 
- If the link is edited in the Android app, the name is removed from the link in server side -> https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/27622
- If the link is removed from Android app, the next one in the list is displayed.

It will require some actions:

- [X] Share activity using full screen instead of dialog style
- [X] Update wording of sections according to last update in iOS
- [X] Replace 'Add user or group' button with (+) button
- [X] Replace switch to on/off public link with (+) button
- [x] Move section with details of public links to new DialogFragment 
- [x] Replace section with details of public link in ShareActivity with list of public shares
- [x] Add icon to delete public share in item list
- [x] Add icon to copy-to-clipboard AND share-with-apps public link in item list
- [x] Add angle icon to edit details in item list
- [x] Add name field to section with details of public link
- [x] For all the things below: ** grant compatibility with server <= 9.x **
- [x] Update domain model and database to support multiple public shares per OCFile
- [x] Update domain model and database to support optional name parameter in OCShares
- [x] Update FileDataStorageManager to retrieve list of public shares for a given file
- [x] Update Get operations to support multiple public links per OCFile
- [x] Update domain model and database to add new property with public link added to OCShare with OC 9.0.0
- [x] Update CreatePublicShareOperation to support multiple public links per OCFile
- [x] Update UpdatePublicShareOperation to support multiple public links per OCFile
- [x] Update RemoveShareOperation to support multiple public links per OCFile, and connect to delete icon
- [x] Connect icon to copy-or-share action
- [x] Connect icon to update existing public share
- [x] Adapt dialog to handle both creation and update of shares correctly
- [x] Handle the different cases when updating the public share password
- [x] Ensure that password is required when server enforces it
- [x] Ensure that expiration date is shown by default when server enforces it
- [x] Enable or disable multiple links support depending on the corresponding capability (see https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/27622) 
- [x] Hide list of public links and title if public share is disabled by admin
- [x] Connect allow editing permissions switch when creating or updating a folder public share 
- [x] Fix UI for private shares after going to full screen ShareActivity
- [X]  Warning about public links: owncloud/enterprise#1914 
- [X] Warning about public links with message "Anyone with the link has access to the file/folder" https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/27844/files 
- [x] Change policy to show warning about public links: depending on server capability
- [x] Clean unneeded code of the previous sharing version
- [x] [QA] Design test plan @jesmrec
- [X] [QA] Validate test plan @jesmrec

___

BUGS & IMPROVEMENTS

- [X] (1) Soft keyboard automatically displayed to input link password https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1928#issuecomment-299834718 [FIXED]
- [X] (2) Ask for confirmation is case of link removing https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1928#issuecomment-299839271 [FIXED] 
- [X] (3) Not allowing to disable password switch if it is forced. https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1928#issuecomment-299847474 [FIXED]
- [X] (4) App crashes if remove expiration (default) https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1928#issuecomment-299849323 [FIXED]
- [X] (5) Link is saved without expiration although it is forced https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1928#issuecomment-299852941 [FIXED]
- [X] (6) Hide link name section when multiple share links are not supported [FIXED]
- [x] Using token as public share name in public shares list makes no sense in servers < 10  https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1928#issuecomment-300077521 [WILL NOT BE FIXED]
- [X] (7) Creation of more than one link is not being prevented in servers < 10 https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1928#issuecomment-299857505 [FIXED]
- [X] (8) Edit public links in servers < 10 https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1928#issuecomment-299862239 [FIXED]

title: Emoji support
body:
Related to: https://github.com/owncloud/platform/issues/24

Folders can be created with emojis in name

To improve:

- Rename/Delete a file with emojis in filename. Error is shown but the action is correctly done.
- Content can not be uploaded to a folder which name contains emojis. Neither manual nor instant nor sharing from other apps. Unknown error in uploads view. On the other hand, a folder can be created with or without emojis into a folder with emojis.
- A file with emojis can not be moved/copied into a folder with emojis 
- Set a folder (empty) as av. offline. An error is displayed

Server must be set to support mb4 characters: https://github.com/owncloud/documentation/issues/2924

title: Duplicated uploads from android client - even in same directory
body:
@nneul commented on [Sun Mar 12 2017](https://github.com/owncloud/client/issues/5601)


### Expected behaviour
Sharing a file multiple times with OwnCloud client on android should not result in multiple duplicate copies of the file in the instant upload directory.

### Actual behaviour
Multiple files created with (2) in the name for example, even though they are checksum identical.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Allow a file to automatically instant upload
2. Share file explicitly with oc - typically as a "I want to make sure everything is uploaded" share in a big batch.

### Client configuration
Client version: 2.3.0
Operating system: Android



I understand your view that in general OC should not concern itself with duplicate uploads/files/etc. but this is a bit of a more relevant/important edge case with mobile. I think there should either be a means to check and avoid duplicating files during upload process when the files are being uploaded to the SAME directory. 


---

@hodyroff commented on [Mon Mar 13 2017](https://github.com/owncloud/client/issues/5601#issuecomment-286033537)

This issue happens on Android, right? Please give us some more information about the Android version you are using and how exactly it can be reproduced. "Share file explicitly with oc" ... I don't understand. Which menu entry in Android are you using to do that?

title: Several Lint Warnings on Android API evolution and others that can be the cause of reported issues
body:
Hello,

I am using Lint to check for warnings in owncloud and found the following warnings may cause noticeable problems:
1. **Call requires permission which may be rejected by user: code should explicitly check to see if permission is available (with `checkPermission`) or explicitly handle a potential `SecurityException`**
Instances of this warning can be found on [line 135 in AccountUtils.java](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/src/com/owncloud/android/authentication/AccountUtils.java#L135) and [line 358 in FileUploader.java](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/src/com/owncloud/android/files/services/FileUploader.java#L358).
I think this may be related to issue like #1846 or #1866 

2. **Use of android.hardware.action.NEW_PICTURE is deprecated for all apps starting with the N release independent of the target SDK. Apps should not rely on these broadcasts and instead use JobScheduler**
This warning is reported in the manifest file.
The documentation for this problem can be found at [Android 7.0 behavior changes](https://developer.android.com/about/versions/nougat/android-7.0-changes.html#bg-opt) that these services will not be sent anymore on Android 7.0. And this is also changed for NEW_VIDEO.
I think this may be related to #1829 

3. **'setCalendarViewShown(boolean)' is deprecated**
The warning is reported at [line 111 in ExpirationDatePickerDialogFragment.java](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/src/com/owncloud/android/ui/dialog/ExpirationDatePickerDialogFragment.java#L111) 
This method is deprecated and not functioning from API level 24. I have found discussions on this warning [here](https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=213497) and [here](https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=222808)

4. **Overrides deprecated method in 'android.webkit.WebViewClient' (onReceiveError)**
The warning is reported at [line 109 ](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/WebViewClient.java#L109)
This API is deprecated according to the API Guide and seems that it may cause crashes like an issue [here](https://github.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/990).

5. **To support older versions than API 17 (project specifies 14) you should also add `android:layout_alignParentRight="true"`** and **`android:layout_alignParentLeft="true"`**
Two warnings are reported on [line 77 and 78 in media_control.xml](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/res/layout/media_control.xml#L77). [android:layout_alignParentStart](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/R.attr.html#layout_alignParentStart) and [android:layout_alignParentEnd](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/R.attr.html#layout_alignParentEnd) are not introduced before API 17.

6. Other deprecated API used:
[`isScreenOn()`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/PowerManager.html#isScreenOn()) at [line 95 in PassCodeManager.java](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/src/com/owncloud/android/authentication/PassCodeManager.java#L95)
[`onAttach(Activity)`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Fragment.html#onAttach(android.app.Activity)) at [line 81 in UploadListFragment](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/042762f19b1a9ac9c076ddfd935822b35db6d9f0/src/com/owncloud/android/ui/fragment/UploadListFragment.java#L81)

7. **This Handler class should be static or leaks might occur (anonymous android.os.Handler)**
This is a posible memory leak issue, found at [line 264 in MediaControlView.java](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/src/com/owncloud/android/media/MediaControlView.java#L264).
Related discussions on warnings of this category can be found [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11407943/this-handler-class-should-be-static-or-leaks-might-occur-incominghandler)

So many links an warnings...
If any links break, please let me know.

Hope these warnings can help to improve owncloud. :)

title: Two way sync - potential solution
body:
### Actual behaviour:
- Files created in a folder which has been previously marked ad "_available offline_" are not automatically uploaded

### Expected behaviour:
- 2way sync (as mentioned in: [#1663](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1663), [#1683](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1683), [#1437](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1437), and [#960](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/960))
Any file created in that folder should be automatically uploaded.
 
### Potential temporary solution:
A free third-party app **Tasker** (https://tasker.dinglisch.net/) is capable of: 1) running a background service monitoring changes in files and folder, 2) sending different types of intents. 

1. Would it be possible to **_send an intent to the ownCloud client forcing upload of a single file_**?
2. What is the intent and syntax of the additional data that needs to be provided for a successful request (I assume at least the local path to the file). After brief analysis of the code I found this: `com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileUploader`, but I am not sure if this is the correct one.

title: Improve error feedback
body:
Fixes #966 

Requires https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/146

To be more specific:
  - when uploads fail due to an untrusted server certificate, a specific error is shown, both in the notification and in list of failed uploads (no more "Unkown error" for this situation";
  - additionally, HTTP status phrase is saved in RemoteOperationResults to use as a fallback when ErrorMessageAdapter does not know a better user message for the result; this message will be used instead of the current "Unknown error" for HTTP error responses that are currently not translated to a localized error message in the app; 
 - Toasts have been replaced with Snackbars where possible (Toasts created by Services or Activities finishing need to remain that way)

Not done:
 - ask the user to accept untrusted certificate clicking on a failed upload in the list of uploads; that is already asked whenever the user tries to browse through the untrusted account; ftm might be enough.

cc @davigonz @jesmrec

### Steps

No way to go to the main menu directly.

To be discussed.

@davivel @owncloud/design

title: Create Contacts/Calendar/Notes intergration
body:
Yes, I know, Davdroid exists.

That said, I am asking, again, for DAV integration into the main client. It adds one extra step that makes owncloud harder to use. This is one hot button issue that virtually everyone wants. Why won't you implement this? As a system administrator, having "one single app" makes my life easier when dealing with users who are not always so technical.

Do you hate us? Are you elitist to the point that if someone can't understand a maze of apps they are unworthy. Is there going to be a pay versions with all the features? Is *Dav impossibly complicated? Do you have a no compete clause with google? Do you just not want owncloud to be production ready useful application? Do you hate the concept of "just work"?

Please tell me its not dogmatic blind faith in the UNIX ideology and you can possibly comprehend why android and mobile in general has a very different approach.

This is just one of these little things which makes me go "ggrrrrr". So close, so fucking close to being really useful.

p.s. while you are at it, please integrate the photo app as well.

title: Authorization Header is not being sent in 2.2.0
body:
### Actual behaviour
Every DAV request (PROPFIND, GET, DELETE) is being sent without Authorization header in first place. Once the server answers "HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized" the client sends the same request, this time with the authorization header


### Expected behaviour
As it happens before 2.2.0 version, the client should send the authorization header in the request, so no duplication happens
 
### Steps to reproduce
No special procedure. Just connect the client to the server and navigate, every PROPFIND, GET, DELETE , PUT, ... are sent without Authorization header in first term.


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
yes

### Environment data
Android version:
7.1.1
Device model: 
Nexus 5x
Stock or customized system:
Stock
ownCloud app version:
2.2.0
ownCloud server version:
9.1.3

### Logs
#### Web server error log


#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)

title: Connection error with auto-disconnect, no notification
body:
### Steps

1. Connect to Wifi
1. Setup the Wifi to auto-disconnect on lock (when the screen locks itself, it will disconnect from Wifi completely and never reconnect until unlocked)
1. Unlock the screen
1. Go to Google's picture app
1. Select many pictures
1. Share and select the ownCloud app
1. Select a destination folder and start the upload
1. Let the phone aside and see the cloud icon in the notification bar, it's uploading
1. Wait for phone to auto-lock, wait longer, go have coffee
1. Come back to phone, unlock it
1. Check notification area

### Expected result
Notification area must display a permanent message "Upload failed due connection problems" or something similar because Android disconnected the Wifi when the phone automatically locked itself.

### Actual result
No notification at all from the ownCloud app.
Two times I thought it successfully finished uploading and when I checked my pics folder from the laptop there were missing pictures.

### Versions
ownCloud server 9.1.3
ownCloud Android app 2.2.0
Android Nexus 4 mobile phone with Android 5.1.1

@davivel even holidays have their bug reports 😉
